author: Chris Roemer
title: Chris Roemer: Butker should ‘rejoice and be exceedingly glad’ he is being persecuted for remaining faithful to God | COMMENTARY – Baltimore Sun
text: Kansas City Chiefs kicker Harrison Butker recently gave a commencement speech at Benedictine College, a private Catholic liberal arts school of higher learning in Atchison, Kansas. Progressives across the country expressed outrage at the message Butker delivered. GLADD, “a non-profit organization focused on LGBTQ advocacy and cultural change,” issued a statement calling Butker’s speech “a clear miss” and “woefully out of step with Americans about Pride, LGBTQ people and women.” That Butker’s comments were “woefully out of step” with American culture is no surprise. The Apostle Paul explains why in 1 Corinthians 2. “The person without the Spirit,” Paul writes, “does not accept the things that come from the Spirit of God but considers them foolishness, and cannot understand them because they are discerned only through the Spirit.” In his Sermon on the Mount, Christ proclaims, “Blessed are ye when men shall revile you, and persecute you, and shall say all manner of evil against you falsely, for my sake. Rejoice, and be exceeding glad: for great is your reward in heaven.” In John’s gospel, Christ told his disciples, “If the world hates you, ye know that it hated me before it hated you. If ye were of the world, the world would love its own: but because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.” Butker should “rejoice and be exceedingly glad” he is being persecuted for remaining faithful to God’s word. Have we really reached a point in American society where women who find fulfillment in marriage, relish their role as a mother and make raising their children a priority are worthy of derision and contempt? Apparently so. What the unbelieving world fails to understand is that a Christian’s beliefs are not whims which change with societal norms. Their beliefs are based on what they consider to be Holy Scripture — the word of God. For the secular world to demand Christians abandon their faith so that their beliefs and values more closely mirror its own is appalling and wrong. To claim that kind of authority over a person’s conscience goes far beyond simple tyranny. It’s the stuff of Kim Jong Un and Mao. Jesus did not poll test his messages before he delivered them. Neither should we. In fact, what Jesus taught was so “out of step” with the culture of his day, not only was he mocked and ridiculed, as Butker is being mocked and ridiculed today, ultimately Jesus was nearly beaten to death — and then crucified. The sad reality is, most people no longer believe the bible is God’s word, or accept its authority over their lives. More and more, God’s word is being marginalized by nominal Christians. Whole Christian denominations are replacing God’s definitions of right and wrong with conceptions of their own creation. Churches everywhere have concluded biblical truth needs to be “modified” so as not to offend an increasingly unbelieving world. That there is a growing tide of hostility toward faithful Christianity is to be expected. Paul warned in 2 Timothy, a “time will come, when they will not endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves teachers, having itching ears; And they shall turn away their ears from the truth, and shall be turned unto fables.” There is no shortage of false teachers in modern society, but the good news is nothing can change that Jesus is still the Lord of the Harvest, and there are souls yet to be gathered into God’s kingdom. We need to continue to pray God sends forth laborers to do the work. It is gratifying someone of Butker’s stature counts himself among them. Since his speech, Butker has not backed down in the face of the avalanche of criticism that has come his way. In response to the criticism, Butker reaffirmed his commitment to his faith, saying, “Our love for Jesus and thus our desire to speak out should never be outweighed by the longing of our fallen nature to be loved by the world.” Jesus never compromised or hid the truth so as not to offend those who did not believe. Neither should we. If we remain faithful despite the criticism we receive, when we come to the end of our lives, like Paul, we will be able to say, “I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith.” Butker intended his comments to be heard by a few hundred Benedictine graduates and their families. God had other plans. He used the abuse hurled at Butker to take those comments around the world, and only God knows the fruit they will bear. And because of his faith in Christ, and only because of his faith in Christ, there is a “crown of righteousness” for Butker, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give him at the day of his appearing. “The world and its desires pass away, but whoever does the will of God lives forever.” — 1 John 2:17 Chris Roemer is a retired banker and educator who resides in Finksburg. author: Estadão Conteúdo
title: Etapa de MotoGP é cancelada por causa das enchentes que castigaram Valência
text:
A última etapa da temporada 2024 do Campeonato Mundial de MotoGP, marcada para Valência, foi cancelada devido às enchentes que atingiram a região. A corrida estava prevista para ser realizada entre os dias 15 e 17 de novembro.
Por meio de um comunicado, a MotoGP informou que em breve, um novo circuito deve ser definido para sediar a última corrida da temporada. A organização prestou sua solidariedade às vítimas da tragédia que já deixou mais de 200 mortos naquela que é considerada a maior enchente do século na Espanha.
“Temos estado em contato constante com as autoridades locais e o circuito para avaliar melhor como podemos ajudar e como devemos proceder. Temos uma responsabilidade com cada região onde corremos que vai muito além do esporte e dos eventos”, diz parte do texto.
A decisão pelo adiamento foi definida após um acordo com as autoridades da Comunidade Valenciana e a Comissão da Segurança. Após o último balanço das autoridades, dezenas de pessoas estão desaparecidas.
Na classificação do Mundial de pilotos, o espanhol Jorge Martín é o favorito ao título e lidera a tabela com 453. O italiano Francesco Bagnaia aparece em segundo lugar e contabiliza 436.

For Q3 alone, Toyota confirms 4,518 unit sales of the Tacoma Hybrid and 4,122 copies of the Tundra Hybrid. Ford's hybrid option for the Maverick was a far more popular option, as the EcoBoost turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder model only managed to rake in 11,740 sales within the same timeframe.

We assume that these problems do affect the hybrid model, considering they all come off the same production line.
Why The Ford Maverick Hybrid's Success Will Continue In 2025
Ford The 2025 Ford Maverick will continue to rise to success thanks to several thoughtful changes that appeal to this year's market trends. As of right now, the 2.5-liter hybrid powertrain is an optionally available powertrain, with the 2.0-liter EcoBoost engine being the standard offering. For 2025, the brand has decided to swap this around in order to make the hybrid a more accessible option. This is a logical move considering a bulk of the sales already go to the hybrid derivative.
Key Changes For The 2025 Ford Maverick Hybrid The 2025 Ford Maverick offers a new hybrid all-wheel drive option for improved traction and versatility. A 13.2-inch touchscreen with the updated Sync 4 system is now standard, including wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto. The Maverick adds a sport-focused Lobo trim with lowered suspension, performance-tuned handling, and exclusive design elements. Off-road enthusiasts can opt for the enhanced Tremor model with trail capabilities. A fresh front-end design includes redesigned headlights and grille for a modern look. New exterior color options, including Eruption Green and Velocity Blue, expand customization. Ford justifies this decision by clarifying that the hybrid offers sufficient performance and fuel economy in relation to the EcoBoost. The addition of an optional all-wheel drive system for the Hybrid further increases its appeal and will likely be a big motivator for many potential buyers to opt for the hybrid Maverick. For 2025, Ford is also adding the Tremor package as a unique trim level for those wanting a more off-road aesthetic. It will also include the Trail Control system for enhanced traction on loose surfaces. The entire range will benefit from more in-depth towing functions via an optional package.

author: McKenna Snow
title: Retired Australian Catholic Bishop Arrested, Charged with Sexual Offenses
text: CV NEWS FEED // Australian authorities this week arrested a retired Catholic bishop on charges of sexual offenses including rape, assault, and child abuse. Retired Bishop Christopher Saunders of Broome, Australia was arrested Wednesday on 19 [charges](https://catholicvote.org/child-abuse-detectives-search-bishop-house/) for offenses that date from 2008 to 2014. Saunders was released on bail on Thursday and remains under house arrest until his hearing, which is set for June. [According](https://www.ncregister.com/cna/australian-bishop-christopher-saunders-arrested-charged-with-rape) to the National Catholic Register, Saunders, 74, was charged with two counts of rape, 14 counts of unlawful and indecent assault, and three counts of “indecently dealing with a child as a person in authority.” The offenses reportedly took place in the towns of Broome, Kununurra, and the Aboriginal community of Kalumburu. Bishop Saunders will plead not guilty to the charges brought against him, according to local reports. On Thursday, the President of the Australian Catholic Bishops Conference, Archbishop Timothy Costelloe [stated](https://www.catholic.au/s/article/Matter-regarding-Bishop-Christopher-Saunders): “Allegations against the former Bishop of Broome, Christopher Saunders are very serious and deeply distressing, especially for those making those allegations.” “It is right and proper, and indeed necessary, that all such allegations be thoroughly investigated,” Costelloe added. “The Church will continue to cooperate fully with the police and take every necessary step to avoid any actions which may compromise the integrity and autonomy of the police investigation.” Allegations against Saunders were first made in 2020. [According](https://www.vaticannews.va/en/church/news/2024-02/christopher-saunders-charged-timothy-costelloe-investigation.html) to Vatican News, independent investigators carried out a [canonical investigation](https://catholicvote.org/australian-bishop-under-vatican-investigation-sexual-misconduct/) ordered by Pope Francis. Saunders resigned in 2021. The investigation ended with a 200 page report that was given to Australian police. Vatican News reported, “After this report was handed over to Australian police, they opened a new investigation into Bishop Emeritus Saunders. It is as part of this investigation that he has now been charged.”

title: Boeing Faces $1.3 Billion Monthly Loss Amid Union Strike Vote - Investors Hangout
text: Boeing Faces $1.3 Billion Monthly Loss Amid Union Strike Vote [Hannah Lewis](https://investorshangout.com/profile/view?id=79548)Updated: 09-13-2024 07:23 AM Major Free Cash Flow Impacts for Boeing Amid IAM Strike Vote Boeing is currently navigating turbulent waters as it faces a potential monthly free cash flow (FCF) impact exceeding $1.3 billion due to a strike vote by the IAM 751 union. This significant possibility arises as the union overwhelmingly opted for a strike after rejecting Boeing's proposed contract. Analysts from Jefferies have highlighted the critical nature of this development for the company’s financial health. Understanding the Union’s Decision to Strike The IAM union made its decision following a decisive 95% rejection of Boeing's offered contract, with a staggering 96% of its members voting in favor of striking action. This overwhelming response suggests deep-rooted dissatisfaction with the current terms and raises questions about Boeing's ability to maintain its operations without significant disruptions. Historical Context of Strikes at Boeing Looking back at history, Jefferies points out that the last major strike in 2008 had severe ramifications. Lasting 58 days, it resulted in more than 100 aircraft delivery delays and a net income impact of approximately $1.2 billion—a financial hit of around $600 million per month. Such impacts serve as a reminder of how prolonged labor actions can ripple through the company's operations. Potential Financial Disruptions Jefferies drew attention to the potential consequences if the current strike is drawn out over time. The 2008 strike culminated in a massive $2.5 billion FCF loss, highlighting the significant financial risks involved in the ongoing action. Therefore, the firm warns that if the IAM strike continues, Boeing's financial situation could worsen dramatically. Union Contract Rejection Factors In early September, the IAM union reached an agreement on a new contract that included wage increases over its duration, starting with a notable 11% hike in the first year followed by a total increase of 25%. Despite these increases, the union members’ dissatisfaction stemmed from insufficient wage growth and the elimination of an AMPP bonus, which had been pivotal in encouraging safety and productivity within the workforce. Concerns over Future Aircraft Developments Another critical issue raised by union members was Boeing’s commitment to developing a next-generation aircraft in Puget Sound, a vital element of the contract discussions. This uncertainty adds another layer of complexity to the negotiations and illustrates the need for Boeing's management to reassess their approach to employee relations. The Urgency for Negotiations Jefferies analysts have stressed that the current strike could be as disruptive as those in Boeing's past. Nonetheless, they believe there is a strong incentive for Boeing’s leadership to engage in swift negotiations aimed at reaching a resolution. The management is likely to strive for a settlement that minimizes operational disruptions and the financial repercussions that accompany prolonged strike activity. With such significant potential losses on the horizon, navigating through this phase will demand strategic planning and effective communication from Boeing. The urgency to address the union's concerns while maintaining steady operations will be paramount to mitigate the escalating financial toll. Frequently Asked Questions What financial impact does the IAM strike have on Boeing? The IAM union strike could result in over $1.3 billion in monthly free cash flow losses for Boeing, a serious financial concern for the company. What led to the union's decision to strike? The union voted to strike after an overwhelming rejection of Boeing's proposed contract, indicating widespread dissatisfaction among its members. What historical context is relevant to Boeing's current situation? The last major strike at Boeing in 2008 resulted in significant delays and a $2.5 billion FCF impact, underscoring the potential financial repercussions of labor disputes. How is Boeing responding to the strike threat? Boeing's leadership is likely to engage in negotiations swiftly to address union concerns and minimize operational disruptions. What are the implications of the contract rejection? The rejection of the contract deal points to deeper issues within employee satisfaction and Boeing’s future commitments to aircraft development. title: Hyderabad Drenches in Rain: Yellow Alert for Thunderstorms Issued, IMD Predicts Week-long Downpour | Times Now
text: Hyderabad: The city continues to be drenched under heavy rains, leading to waterlogging in several parts. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for thunderstorms and lightning. Residents can expect a continuous spell of rain as IMD predicts week-long rainfall in the capital of Telangana.Hyderabad Weather ForecastThe weather forecast for the upcoming week indicates a mix of conditions in the region. On May 9 and 10, a partly cloudy sky prevails with the potential for rain, thunderstorms, or dust storms. These atmospheric phenomena can be dynamic and may affect local weather patterns. On May 11, the weather remains consistent with partly cloudy skies and the possibility of rain, thunderstorms, or dust storms. However, the likelihood of these events is subject to local variations and atmospheric conditions. May 12th sees a shift towards clearer skies, with partly cloudy conditions prevailing. Finally, on May 13th, the forecast suggests partly cloudy skies with a heightened potential for moderate rain or thunderstorms.Telangana Weather UpdateAfter a bout of heavy rains and thunderstorms on Tuesday, the weather across the state has settled into a comparatively calmer pattern. IMD reported light to moderate rains in isolated areas of Adilabad, Hyderabad, Medchal-Malkajgiri, Rangareddy, and Sangareddy districts. Meanwhile, districts like Jagtial, Kamareddy, Medak, Rajanna Sircilla, Siddipet, and Vikarabad experienced moderate rains and thundershowers. Additionally, hailstorms were observed in isolated places across Adilabad, Medak, Mancherial, Kumurambheem Asifabad, Rajanna Sircilla, and Peddapalli districts. Temperatures also took a noticeable dip, with the highest maximum temperature remaining below 44 degrees Celsius. Nizamabad recorded the highest temperature at 42.9 degrees Celsius, while Hyderabad, the capital city, saw a maximum temperature of 40.2 degrees Celsius in Rajendranagar.The IMD reported a weather system affecting the region, with a trough extending from northeast Rajasthan to south interior Karnataka across central Maharashtra and north interior Karnataka at 0.9 km above mean sea level (MSL). This system is expected to bring continued light to moderate rains and thundershowers until May 14.A yellow alert has been issued for the state until May 11, followed by an orange alert on May 12, indicating a likelihood of intensified rains accompanied by lightning and gusty winds of around 40–50 kmph in many districts. Over the next 48 hours, the city is expected to experience light to moderate rains or thundershowers, with maximum and minimum temperatures of 38 degrees elsius and 24 degrees Celsius respectively, and relative humidity of 62 pc.
